name: sui
description: a startpage for your server and / or new tab page
readme_summary: SUI is a customizable startpage and new tab page designed for servers and personal use. It allows users to easily organize applications and bookmarks, with options for theming and deployment via Docker.
key_features: Git pull variant for automatic updates
primary_use_case: To provide a personalized and organized dashboard for servers or as a browser's new tab page.
cover_image_prompt: A digital workbench where a user is meticulously arranging glowing icons representing applications and neatly organized stacks of digital scrolls labeled 'bookmarks'. The workbench itself is a clean, modern interface, subtly showing the repository name 'SUI' on a small screen. Floating around are subtle data streams and a color palette selector, indicating customization options. The overall scene is bright and organized, conveying a sense of personalized control and easy access to information. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, flat design aesthetic and vibrant, user-friendly colors.

name: pause-windows-updates
description: Pause & disable Windows updates for any duration. Remove Recall / Copilot. Debloat / privacy / telemetry tools. Supports Windows 10 and 11.
readme_summary: The Windows Personalization Utility (WPU) is a batch and registry script tool designed to give users control over Windows updates and system privacy. It allows for pausing updates indefinitely, removing telemetry, debloating apps and services, and applying various system tweaks for a more personalized Windows experience.
primary_use_case: To provide users with granular control over Windows updates, system privacy, and bloatware, allowing for a customized and more secure Windows environment.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old clockmaker meticulously adjusting the gears of a giant, ornate grandfather clock that represents a Windows PC. Instead of ticking, the clock's pendulum is a large 'pause' button, frozen mid-swing. Around the clockmaker's workbench are scattered tools, some labeled 'Privacy Shield,' 'Bloatware Remover,' and 'Registry Key.' Digital particles representing data flow from the clockmaker's tools to the clock, subtly enhancing its functionality and appearance. The scene is set in a cozy, well-lit workshop, conveying a sense of control and customization. The overall style is a 3D isometric illustration with a warm, inviting color palette, emphasizing the repository's ability to put users back in charge of their system.

name: public-ip-address
description: Rust crate to retrieve public IP address and geolocation data. ðŸ¦€
readme_summary: This Rust crate, `public-ip-address`, provides a straightforward way to retrieve a user's public IP address and associated geolocation data. It supports multiple lookup services, offers both asynchronous and blocking interfaces, and includes optional caching with encryption for privacy and performance.
key_features: Retrieve public IP address from multiple services
Support for arbitrary IP address lookup and API keys
primary_use_case: To programmatically obtain a client's public IP address and its geographical location within a Rust application.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, friendly robot holding a magnifying glass over a glowing globe, pinpointing a specific location with a digital marker. The robot is actively scanning, with faint lines of data flowing from the globe towards a small, clean UI element displaying an IP address and country name. The background is a subtle, abstract network pattern. The overall mood is informative and accessible, with a clean, modern aesthetic. The art style should be a 3D isometric illustration with bright, clear colors and soft lighting, emphasizing clarity and ease of use. The repository name 'public-ip-address' is subtly integrated into the robot's chassis.

name: warpnet
description: WarpNet is a decentralized, peer-to-peer social network inspired by Twitter, built with Go. It runs without central servers, using Noise protocol for inter-node communication and built-in local storage. WarpNet is censorship-resistant, scalable, and fully open-source.
readme_summary: WarpNet is a decentralized, peer-to-peer social network built with Go, inspired by Twitter. It operates without central servers, utilizing the Noise protocol for secure communication and local storage for data persistence. This design makes WarpNet censorship-resistant, scalable, and fully open-source.
primary_use_case: To provide a censorship-resistant and decentralized alternative to traditional social media platforms like Twitter.
cover_image_prompt: A vibrant, bustling marketplace where individuals are connected by glowing, invisible threads, sharing messages and ideas freely without any central authority or towering buildings. Each person holds a small, personal device displaying their thoughts, and these thoughts are instantly and securely transmitted to others through a decentralized network visualized as a complex, interconnected web of light. Subtle UI elements showing message bubbles and user profiles are integrated into the scene. The overall mood is one of freedom and open communication. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a bright, optimistic color palette and clear, distinct elements.

name: runtime-radar
readme_summary: Runtime Radar is an open-source solution for monitoring runtime security events and responding to incidents within containerized environments. It offers flexible configuration, centralized multi-cluster management, and integration with existing security systems, providing accessible protection and user-friendly tools.
key_features: Flexible monitoring configuration of runtime events via web interface
Integration with syslog, SMTP, and webhook
Develop custom detectors (signatures) in Go using an SDK
Incident investigation tools in the web interface, including process context viewing and response rule creation
primary_use_case: Monitoring and responding to runtime security threats in containerized environments.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant lighthouse keeper on a rocky outcrop, using a powerful, glowing spyglass to scan the turbulent sea for approaching storm clouds (representing security threats). The spyglass projects beams of light that highlight specific dangerous waves (runtime events) and alert a nearby control tower (centralized management). Small, stylized icons representing different threat types (e.g., a mining pickaxe, a broken lock) are visible on the sea. The lighthouse itself subtly incorporates the 'Runtime Radar' name. The scene is set during a dramatic twilight with a clear, focused composition, rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant, contrasting colors for threats and safe areas.

name: flint
description: Lightweight tool for managing linux virtual machines
readme_summary: Flint is a lightweight, self-contained KVM management tool that provides a modern Web UI, CLI, and API for managing virtual machines. It aims for zero bloat and maximum efficiency, simplifying VM management without relying on complex XML configurations.
key_features: Modern Web UI, CLI, and API
Provides binaries for glibc and musl (Alpine Linux)
primary_use_case: Simplifying and streamlining the management of KVM virtual machines through a user-friendly interface and a streamlined, bloat-free tool.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan, dressed in modern tech attire, is meticulously crafting intricate clockwork mechanisms that represent virtual machines. They are using a sleek, minimalist workbench with glowing digital blueprints and tooltips floating around. The artisan is assembling gears and springs (representing VM components) with precision, and each completed mechanism smoothly powers up a small, glowing digital world. Subtle UI elements resembling a clean dashboard are integrated into the workbench. The overall mood is efficient and modern, with a clean, bright aesthetic. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with high detail and a focus on clarity.
